item.title: My Favorite Flowers
Restriction Digestion and Ligation
item.description: The picture above is immunofluorescence of laser microirradiated cells. The lines of red are where the specific damage occured and lines of green are where the protein is recruited. It really has nothing to do with the codes below, but it is cool to look at. I am going to show you how to cut fragments from sequences using regex in python. The sequence below is for the protein ZNF219 (which if you go to my resume you’ll see that it’s the protein I’m working on), and I am trying to use NotI, which cuts at GC/GGCCGC:

item.title: Measles and Schools
item.description: Yu Qin This is a document exploring vaccination in schools, with an interest to see if there is a difference in measles vaccination rates between public and private schools. The dataset includes the US state the school is located in (state), the category of school (type), private or public, the MMR (measles, mumps, rubella) vaccination rate for the school (mmr), enrollment number of the school (enroll), and medical vaccination exemption rate in the school (xmed).

item.title: Corruption and Welfare
item.description: Yu Qin yq895 This is a document exploring the various identification indices of countries, with a particular emphasis on how corruption is related to each index. Each dataset represents an index with the value, year, and country. Corruption perceptions index (CPI) is determined by each country’s pereived levels of corruption in the public sector, taken from surveys and assessments. The scale goes from 0-100 and the higher the CPI, the less corrupt.

item.title: About
item.description: About Hi! I’m Haity. I am a soon-to-be graduate of The University of Texas at Austin. My degree is in Human Biology and Neuroscience. I do a lot of research but aside from that, I also like to take landscape pictures. Come check out my Instagram! View this post on Instagram A post shared by Haity Qin (@ninjaoranges) on Jul 10, 2016 at 4:55pm PDT
